dt: {bc}to imagine (one) to be guilty or culpable on slight evidence or without proof
{bc}to imagine to exist or be true, likely, or probable
{bc}to imagine something to be true or likely

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}suspectare{/it}, frequentative of {it}suspicere{/it} to look up at, regard with awe, suspect, from {it}sub-, sus-{/it} up, secretly + {it}specere{/it} to look at {ma}{mat|sub-|}, {mat|spy|}{/ma}
shortdef: to imagine (one) to be guilty or culpable on slight evidence or without proof
to imagine to exist or be true, likely, or probable
one that is suspected; especially : a person suspected of a crime

dt: {bc}the usual people or things that are suspected or thought of in a particular situation

dt.t: The breakfast menu had all {it}the usual suspects{/it}—eggs, pancakes, waffles, and French toast.

shortdef: the usual people or things that are suspected or thought of in a particular situation —often used humorously
